intro: Mesembryanthemum calendulaceum, commonly known as the yellow flower of the desert, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring a shallow root system and the ability to store water in its leaves. It blooms during the cooler months, typically in spring or early summer, and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Mesembryanthemum calendulaceum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant, sun-loving blooms.
